title: "Mages should run out of mana if they cast constantly in long fights"

The moment when a 10% mana refund on demand is made out to be a disadvantage

Think about Lissandra's passive.  Getting mana back or having a free spell is often associated with the need to make efficient use of the effect, which we can see might be the case here with Ryze's Q now costing twice the mana at max rank.  If he wants to clear much he will have to use his Rune Prison for the mana instead of the CC pretty frequently.  If he uses it for mana then you have a window to fight him when he has no CC.

If the changes work out then the mana back merely allows him to function at all while being more fun to play against.

scarra commented on this actually. all he has to do is push the wave. and last hit the last minion of the wave with w and then walk away. he gets the mana back and you cant fight him cause he is under tower and by the time the next minion wave rolls up its off cd again for him to repeat the process
Yes, because the mana cost of his other spells are taking the potential refund into account.

By that you mean the +40 Mana cost at max rank for Q?
Meanwhile he needs 50 - 90 less Mana in rotation because W no longer costs anything, plus it refunds.

Before this, his basic maxed rotation costed 40 + 90 + 100 Mana (230), refunding nothing.
After this, his basic maxed rotation costs 80 + 0 + 100 Mana (180), while refunding 10% Max Mana.

That 40 Mana cost increase compensated him losing 90 Mana cost, even there not fully. So not only he got buffed by needing less Mana for rotation, he got the Mana refund on top of it.

With extended combos, he will usually just use more Es and Qs, where Es are unchanged and this just means paying 40 more Mana per repeated Q. He would need to cast it three times in one combo (omegalul) to pay 30 more mana at which point it gets refunded by the new W mechanic requiring 500 - 300 Mana.

So I can't find the "the mana cost of his other spells are taking the potential refund into account" part. With 500 - 300 Mana it's power shift, with more Mana it's buff.
Not all spells are used equally, his E and Q are spammed A LOT more than his W

"Mages should run out of mana in prolonged team fights." And why aren't tanks losing out armor and many of them keep endless sustain? Why ADCs, Skirmishers and Divers never run out of auto attacks with their consistent damage and on-hit effects? Some champs don't even HAVE mana as a resource they need to manage.
Why mages are the only ones who need to become defenseless as a prolonged fight goes on? This is not very fair balancing.

Then again...my opinion can be a bit skewered cause mages are my favorite type of champions to play, so take my points with a pinch of salt, but i fail to see how this would improve gameplay.
